responses: Hello, Thanks for visiting.

Hello
Happy to help!
Any time!

patterns: Can you do something for me?
responses: I'm here to help you.
I can help you.
I'm here to solve your queries.

patterns: How much rainfall does rice require?
What is the required amount of rain for rice?
responses: Rice requires a minimum rainfall of 115 cm. Although the regions having average annual rainfall between 175 to 300 cm are the most suitable.

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for rice?
Rice is suitable for which soil
responses: Rice is suitable for Red soil and Black cotton soil.

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow rice
Required water for rice cultivation of rice
Amount of water required to cultivate rice
responses: Rice requires 800 mm to 1,200 mm of water with extremes between 520 mm and 2,550 mm during the growing season.

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing rice
responses:
The sowing time of Madhu, Mahaveer and Puspha rice are Kharif (April - September), Rabi (October - December), Summer/Zaid (January - March).
  The sowing time of Abilash, Intan and Hemavati rice are Kharif (April - September).

patterns: How long does it take for rice to grow
Time taken by rice to mature
What is the time taken by rice to mature
responses: Time taken by rice to mature is 160-170 days.

patterns: What is the seed requirement for rice
What is the seed rate of rice
responses: Seed requirement of rice is 20 kg per hectare

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for rice
How to apply the fertilizers for rice
responses: Apply TNAU Rainfed rice MN mixture 12.5 kg/ha as EFYM at 1:10 ratio incubated for 30 days at friable moisture.

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for rice
responses: Lambda-cyhalothrin,malathion and zeta-cypermethrin are all broad-spectrum pesticides used on rice.

patterns: Locaton at which rice can be grown
responses: Suitable zone in Karnataka are Hill Zone.

patterns: How much rainfall does ragi require?
What is the required amount of rain for ragi?
responses: It requires 800 mm to 1,200 mm of water with extremes between 520 mm and 2,550 mm during the growing season.

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for ragi?
Ragi is suitable for which soil
responses: It is cultivated mostly in red lateritic soils.

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow ragi
Required water for ragi cultivation of ragi
Amount of water required to cultivate ragi
responses: It is suited for cultivation in areas with annual rainfall of 700-1200mm. it does not tolerate heavy rainfall and requires a dry spell at the time of grain ripening.

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing ragi
responses: The sowing time is between Kar or Early Kharif (April - August),Kharif (July - November),Late kharif (August - November) ,Rabi (October -September) Summer (January - May)

patterns: How long does it take for ragi to grow
Time taken by ragi to mature
What is the time taken by ragi to mature
responses: Time taken to mature is 90-95 days.

patterns: What is the seed requirement for ragi
What is the seed rate of ragi
responses: Seed requirement is 10 to 15 kg per hectare

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for ragi
How to apply the fertilizers for ragi
responses: 50% of recommended nitrogen is to be applied at sowing and the remaining 50% in two equal splits at 25-30 and 40-45 days after sowing.

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for ragi
responses: Any  one of the insecticides- monocrotophos 1.6 ml,Chlorpyriphos 2.5 ml or Quinalphos 2.5 ml or Acephate 1 gm or Carbaryl 3 gm or Cartap hydrochloride2 gm/lit to be sprayed  two times at 10 days interval or apply cartap hydrochloride 4G 10Kg/acre

patterns: Locaton at which ragi can be grown
responses: Suitable region in Karnataka are Bangalore,Kolar,Tumkur,Shimoga,Mysore,Davanagere etc.

patterns: How much rainfall does jowar require?
What is the required amount of rain for jowar?
responses: It thrives well at a temperature between 25 C and 32 C but below 16 C is not good for the crop. Jowar crop requires rainfall about 40 cm annually.

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for jowar?
Jowar is suitable for which soil
responses: Grows well in loam soils having good drainage. Soil pH range of 6 to 7.5 is ideal for its cultivation and better growth.

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow jowar
Required water for jowar cultivation of jowar
Amount of water required to cultivate jowar
responses: It requires 450 to 650 l of water

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing jowar
responses: The sowing time is between 5th September to 15th October.

patterns: How long does it take for jowar to grow
Time taken by jowar to mature
What is the time taken by jowar to mature
responses: Time taken to mature is 180-240 days.

patterns: What is the seed requirement for jowar
What is the seed rate of jowar
responses: Seed requirement is 8 kg seed/ha

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for jowar
How to apply the fertilizers for jowar
responses: Recommended dose of fertilizer for sweet sorghum in soils with normal fertility levels is 80kg of nitrogen,60 kg of phosphorous and 40 kg of potassium.

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for jowar
responses: Shoot fly can be managed by the soil application of Carbofuran 3G at 8 to 10 kg/ha.

patterns: Locaton at which jowar can be grown
responses: Predominantly grown in districts of Northern Karnataka.

patterns: How much rainfall does maize require?
What is the required amount of rain for maize?
responses: It mostly in grown regions having annual rainfall between 60 cm to 110 cm.

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for maize?
Maize is suitable for which soil
responses: Best suitable soil is deep, red rich soils, where there is abundant nitrogen.

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow maize
Required water for maize cultivation of maize
Amount of water required to cultivate maize
responses: It requires 500 to 800 liter of water

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing maize
responses: The sowing time is between May - August.

patterns: How long does it take for maize to grow
Time taken by maize to mature
What is the time taken by maize to mature
responses: Time taken to mature is 120  days.

patterns: What is the seed requirement for maize
What is the seed rate of maize
responses: Seed requirement is 25 kg/ha

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for maize
How to apply the fertilizers for maize
responses: Apply TNAU MN mixture  30 kg /ha

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for maize
responses: Fungicides are used as pesticide.

patterns: Locaton at which maize can be grown
responses: It is grown all around Kranataka.

patterns: How much rainfall does pulses require?
What is the required amount of rain for pulses?
responses: It requires a moderate amount of rainfall of 25-75 cms.

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for pulses?
Pulses is suitable for which soil
responses: The most ideal soil would be a well drained loam with a pH range from 4.7 to 7.5.

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow pulses
Required water for pulses cultivation of pulses
Amount of water required to cultivate pulses
responses: It requires 500 to 700 liter of water

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing pulses
responses: The sowing time is between (Kharif) May - August,(Rabi) September - February

patterns: How long does it take for pulses to grow
Time taken by pulses to mature
What is the time taken by pulses to mature
responses: Time taken to mature is 80 to 100 days.

patterns: What is the seed requirement for pulses
What is the seed rate of pulses
responses: Seed requirement is 20 kg/ha

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for pulses
How to apply the fertilizers for pulses
responses: Apply fertilizers basally before sowing. Rainfed : 12.5 kg N + 25 kg P2O5 + 12.5 kg K2O +10 kg S*/ha,Irrigated : 25 kg N + 50 kg P2O5 + 25 kg K2O + 20 kg S*/ha

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for pulses
responses: Foliar spray of NAA 40 mg/litre and Salicylic acid 100 mg/litre once at pre-flowering and another at 15 days thereafter

patterns: Locaton at which pulses can be grown
responses: Suitable zone in Karnataka are West Coast Plains and Hills Region.

patterns: How much rainfall does cashew require?
What is the required amount of rain for cashew?
responses: Areas where the temperatures range from 20 to 30 C with an annual precipitationof 1000 - 2000 mm

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for cashew?
Cashew is suitable for which soil
responses: For the best production deep,well-drained sandy or sandy-loam soil is recommended.

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow cashew
Required water for cashew cultivation of cashew
Amount of water required to cultivate cashew
responses: Yearly rainfall of 1 000 mm is sufficient for production but 1 500 to 2 000 mm can be regarded as optimal.

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing cashew
responses: The sowing time is throught the year.

patterns: How long does it take for cashew to grow
Time taken by cashew to mature
What is the time taken by cashew to mature
responses: Its flowering period is from January to April with 2-4 nuts per panicle.

patterns: What is the seed requirement for cashew
What is the seed rate of cashew
responses: Seed requirement is 160 tree per acre.

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for cashew
How to apply the fertilizers for cashew
responses: 10-15 kg of farmyard manure or compost annually is generally recommended forcashew.

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for cashew
responses: Organochlorine pesticide are used as Pesticide.

patterns: Locaton at which cashew can be grown
responses: Suitable zone in Karnataka are Dakshina Kannada,Udupi,Belgaum,Chickballapur,Uttara Kannada,Kodagu and Kolar.

patterns: How much rainfall does coconut require?
What is the required amount of rain for coconut?
responses: A well distributed rainfall of 1300   2300 mm per annum is preferred

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for coconut?
Coconut is suitable for which soil
responses: Thrive well under different soil conditions varying from littoral sands to red loams and laterites.

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow coconut
Required water for coconut cultivation of coconut
Amount of water required to cultivate coconut
responses: An adult palm requires 600 to 800 litres of water once in four to seven days.

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing coconut
responses: The sowing time is throught the year.

patterns: How long does it take for coconut to grow
Time taken by coconut to mature
What is the time taken by coconut to mature
responses: It begins to bear in about 8 to 10 years after planting

patterns: What is the seed requirement for coconut
What is the seed rate of coconut
responses: Coconut trees to an extent of 69 trees in one acre of land

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for coconut
How to apply the fertilizers for coconut
responses: A foliar fertilizer is the best method for application.

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for coconut
responses: Hanging two plastic bottles (200 mg. capacity) with the help of a strong plastic yarn or twine yarn filled with kerosene would prevent the insecticide.

patterns: Locaton at which coconut can be grown
responses: It is grown all around Kranataka.

patterns: How much rainfall does arecanut require?
What is the required amount of rain for arecanut?
responses: Grown in areas receiving annual rainfall of 750 mm in Maidan parts of Karnataka to 4,500 mm

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for arecanut?
Arecanut is suitable for which soil
responses: The depth of soil should be at least 1 m with 4.5-7.6 pH.

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow arecanut
Required water for arecanut cultivation of arecanut
Amount of water required to cultivate arecanut
responses: The average CWR is observed to vary from 19 to 23 litres/day for juvenile to adult arecanut crop.

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing arecanut
responses: They are irrigated once in 7 days during November-December,every six days during February and every four days during March-May.

patterns: How long does it take for arecanut to grow
Time taken by arecanut to mature
What is the time taken by arecanut to mature
responses: Bearing starts after 3-5 years of planting.

patterns: What is the seed requirement for arecanut
What is the seed rate of arecanut
responses: Average of 550 to 600 arecanut trees in one acre of land.

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for arecanut
How to apply the fertilizers for arecanut
responses: A fertilizer dose of 100g N,40g P2O2 and 140g K2O (200g of urea; 200g of rock phosphate and 230 g of muriate of Potash) per palm per year is recommended.

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for arecanut
responses: Pesticide required for arecanut Annual application of 100 g N (220 g urea),40 g P2O5 (200 g rock phosphate) and 140 g K2O (235 g muriate of potash) in addition to 12 kg each of green leaf and compost per palm per year is recommended.

patterns: Locaton at which arecanut can be grown
responses: It is largely grown in South Kanara district of Karnataka

patterns: How much rainfall does chillies require?

responses: It is grown in areas receiving an annual precipitation of 25-30 inches.

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for chillies?

responses: It is grown in all type of soft but the sandy - loam,clay loam and loam soils are best suited for it

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing chillies

patterns: How long does it take for chillies to grow
Time taken by chillies to mature

responses: Time taken to mature is 60 to 120 days

patterns: What is the seed requirement for chillies
What is the seed rate of chillies
responses: Seed requirement is 1.5 kg seed/ha.

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for chillies
How to apply the fertilizers for chillies
responses: Nitrogen requirement for chillies is 120 kg/ha.

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for chillies
responses: Metam potassium are used as pesticide.

patterns: How much rainfall does cotton require?
What is the required amount of rain for cotton?
responses: Annual rainfall of 55-100 cm is ideal for cotton Cultivation

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for cotton?
Cotton is suitable for which soil
responses: This cotton is suitable for Red soil and Black cotton soil.

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow cotton
Required water for cotton cultivation of cotton
Amount of water required to cultivate cotton
responses: Individual cotton plant requires about 10 gallons of water to achieve maximum yield potential.

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing cotton
responses: The sowing time is between  July -September or February - March

patterns: How long does it take for cotton to grow
Time taken by cotton to mature
What is the time taken by cotton to mature
responses: Time taken to mature is approximately 150 to 180 days

patterns: What is the seed requirement for cotton
What is the seed rate of cotton
responses: On average 90.000-100.000 plants per hectare.

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for cotton
How to apply the fertilizers for cotton
responses: In Karnataka entire NPK at planting ( rain fed cotton ),Half N and entire P & K planting,remaining N at flowering (irrigated cotton ) N in 4 splits in irrigated hybrid cotton.

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for cotton
responses: Cotton growers typically use many of the most hazardous pesticides on the market including aldicarb,phorate,methamidophos and endosulfan.

patterns: Locaton at which cotton can be grown
responses: High yielding varieties are cultivated in the districts like Raichur,Bagalkot,Bijapur,Bellaiy,Dharwad and Belgaum under irrigated conditions.

patterns: How much rainfall does sugarcane require?
What is the required amount of rain for sugarcane?
responses: Rainfall: 100 cm to 175 cm rainfall is ideal for sugarcane production

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for sugarcane?
Sugarcane is suitable for which soil
responses: It grows well in deep,well-drained soils of medium fertility of sandy loam soil textures with a pH range from 6.0 to 7.7.

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow sugarcane
Required water for sugarcane cultivation of sugarcane
Amount of water required to cultivate sugarcane
responses: A crop requires 1500- 2500 mm of available water per year

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing sugarcane
responses: In general January to march is the period of planting

patterns: How long does it take for sugarcane to grow
Time taken by sugarcane to mature
What is the time taken by sugarcane to mature
responses: It takes about 12 to 18 months to mature.

patterns: What is the seed requirement for sugarcane
What is the seed rate of sugarcane
responses: On an average 36,000 three budded setts or 60 quintal of seed are sufficient for planting one hectare land area.

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for sugarcane
How to apply the fertilizers for sugarcane
responses: Apply P fertilizer based on soil test values. Otherwise apply super phosphate (375 kg/ha) along the furrows and incorporate with hand hoe.

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for sugarcane
responses: The insecticides acetamiprid and cypermethrin were used to manage aphids while four different insecticides controlled thrips. .

patterns: Locaton at which sugarcane can be grown
responses: Most of the sugarcane is grown with the help of irrigation. Belgaum,Mandya,Mysore,Bijapur,Shimoga and Chitradurga are important producing districts.

patterns: How much rainfall does tobacco require?
What is the required amount of rain for tobacco?
responses: For tobacco 50-100cm annual rainfall and 15-20o C temperature during growth period is ideal.

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for tobacco?
Tobacco is suitable for which soil
responses: Tobacco crop requires light to medium loam soil

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow tobacco
Required water for tobacco cultivation of tobacco
Amount of water required to cultivate tobacco
responses: The tobacco water requirement throughout the growth period ranged from 159.00 to 278.90 mm

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing tobacco
responses: The ideal months to plant tobacco are November and December

patterns: How long does it take for tobacco to grow
Time taken by tobacco to mature
What is the time taken by tobacco to mature
responses: Usually matures and is ready for harvest 3 to 5 weeks after topping.

patterns: What is the seed requirement for tobacco
What is the seed rate of tobacco
responses: A seed rate of 3-5 kg per hectare.

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for tobacco
How to apply the fertilizers for tobacco
responses: It is reported that 40-90% of the phosphorusrequirement of the plant is met with by applying fertilizer four weeks after the transplanting.

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for tobacco
responses: Pyrethroid of the cyano pyrethroid are used as pesticide.

patterns: Locaton at which tobacco can be grown
responses: Suitable zone in Karnataka are Mysuru and Hassan.

patterns: How much rainfall does soyabean require?
What is the required amount of rain for soyabean?
responses: Requiring a minimum of 400mm

patterns: What type of soil is suitable for soyabean?
Soyabean is suitable for which soil
responses: This soyabean is suitable for Red soil .

patterns: What is the amount of water required to grow soyabean
Required water for soyabean cultivation of soyabean
Amount of water required to cultivate soyabean
responses: Soybeans require from 15 to 25 inches of water per acre per year from planting through maturity depending on planting date,maturity group,location,and weather.

patterns: Which all months are suitable for sowing soyabean
responses: Kharif season time of sowing is onset of monsoon or last week of June to first week of Jully while in spring sowing is done between 15th of February and 15th of March.

patterns: How long does it take for soyabean to grow
Time taken by soyabean to mature
What is the time taken by soyabean to mature
responses: Soybeans for shelling and fresh use are ready for harvest 45 to 65 days after sowing.

patterns: What is the seed requirement for soyabean
What is the seed rate of soyabean
responses: 70-80 kg seed per hectare is required.

patterns: Which fertilizers should be used for soyabean
How to apply the fertilizers for soyabean
responses: The critical level for phosphorus is 15 ppm and the maintenance range for soybeans is 15 ppm,so P soil test levels should be maintained between 15 and 30 ppm.

patterns: Which pesticides should be used for soyabean
responses: Asana XL are used as pesticide.

patterns: Locaton at which soyabean can be grown
responses: Suitable zone in Karnataka are West Coast Plains and Hills Region.
